response.answer_text: Thomas Jefferson was the primary author and one of the five on the drafting committee appointed by Congress. The head of the committee was John Adams, who selected Jefferson to prepare the original draft. Ironically, both Jefferson and Adams would die on July 4, 1826, the 50th anniversary of the publishing of the Declaration. Benjamin Franklin provided some edits and suggestions, which Jefferson included. The two other members of the drafting committee were Robert Sherman and Robert Livingston. Fifty six members of the Congress signed the final document. The original signed copy is still in the National Archives.

Thomas Jefferson is the man credited with writing the Declaration, but he almost surely had help from other people, James Madison is a popular suggestion. It was signed by many people within the colonies who wanted to see the country free. This link might help too! :) The Declaration of Independence
